  • Method Details

    • readCsv

      public static List<String[]> readCsv(String filename, int expectedColumns)
      Reads data from a specified CSV file. Skips the header row and empty lines. Attempts to handle quoted fields containing the delimiter. Validates the number of columns per row against the expected count. If the file doesn't exist, it attempts to create it with the appropriate header. Handles a specific edge case for older ProjectList.csv files missing the 'Visibility' column.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path to the CSV file.
      expectedColumns - The expected number of columns in each data row (excluding header).
      Returns:
      A List of String arrays, where each array represents a row of data. Returns an empty list if the file doesn't exist or contains no valid data.

    • writeCsv

      public static void writeCsv(String filename, List<String[]> data)
      Writes data to a specified CSV file, overwriting existing content. Ensures the parent directory exists. Escapes fields containing delimiters, quotes, or newlines before writing.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path to the CSV file.
      data - A List of String arrays, where the first array is typically the header and subsequent arrays are data rows.

    • getHeaderForFile

      private static String[] getHeaderForFile(String filename)
      * Returns the appropriate header for a given file based on its name.
      Parameters:
      filename - The name of the file.
      Returns:
      The header for the file, or null if the file name is not recognized.

    • escapeCsvField

      private static String escapeCsvField(String field)
      Escapes a CSV field by enclosing it in quotes if it contains the delimiter, quotes, or newlines. Also doubles any existing quotes within the field.
      Parameters:
      field - The field to escape.
      Returns:
      The escaped field.
